data.title: Special Event Venues
data.text:
The City of Raleigh has many unique rental facilities which might be perfect for your wedding or other special event. Explore the list below to learn about our unique sites from historic chapels to scenic cottages. Contact information for each site varies. Click in each site for more details.

Anne Gordon Center for Active Adults

919-996-4720 | 1901 Spring Forest Road

Indoor facility with one large, dividable multi-purpose room and 120 maximum capacity; One small room with 20 maximum capacity and kitchen

Alcohol permit available

Wi-Fi throughout

Built-in projector, screen, and sound system

Learn More about Anne Gordon Center for Active Adults

Borden Building

919-996-4363 | 820 Clay Street

Borden Building

Indoor and outdoor venue, 102 seated/150 max capacity, $110/hr for Raleigh residents, $160/hr for non-residents (4 hour minimum)

City of Raleigh Museum

919-996-2220 | 220 Fayetteville St. 27601

The City of Raleigh Museum's lobby, first floor gallery and lower level classroom are available for functions such as rehearsal dinners, buffet receptions, fundraisers, seminars, and workshops.

Five Points Center for Active Adults

919-996-4730 | 2000 Noble Road, 27608

4,000 square foot ballroom that is dividable into three separate sections

The ballroom can accommodate approximately 300 theater-style, 220 at tables

Two kitchens available

Alcohol permit available

Wi-Fi throughout the facility

House sound in ballroom

Audio visual packages available with LCD (liquid-crystal display)

projectors and screens

Learn More about Five Points Center for Active Adults

Lake Johnson

919-996-3141 | 4601 Avent Ferry Rd, 27606

Waterfront Conference Room

Indoor/outdoor venue; maximum capacity 50 seated. Rates begin at $75/hour (two-hour minimum). The adjacent veranda and deck may also be reserved for additional fees.

Learn more about Lake Johnson Park

Mordecai Historic Park

1 Mimosa St, 27604

Contact: Vanessa Jeter | 919-996-4363

Park Grounds

Outdoor venue, 150 capacity, $100/hr for Raleigh residents, $150/hr for non-residents (two hour minimum)

St. Mark's Chapel

Indoor venue, 55 seated/70 max capacity, $75/hr for Raleigh residents, $125/hr for non-residents (8 hour minimum), No food or drink permitted inside chapel.

Learn More about Mordecai Historic Park

The Raleigh Trolley

Contact: Vanessa Jeter | 919-996-4363

The Raleigh Trolley is available for rent for special event transportation or for private charter tours. No food or drink are allowed on the trolley.*

Learn More about The Raleigh Trolley

Thomas G. Crowder Woodland Center at Lake Johnson

919-996-3141 | 5611 Jaguar Park Dr, 27606

As an extension of the Lake Johnson Parkâ€™s Waterfront Program Center, the Thomas G. Crowder Woodland Center offers the people of Raleigh even more ways than ever before to host an event in a beautiful, natural setting. The facility has both indoor and outdoor spaces available for rent, and you may choose to use one or more of them for your event, depending on your needs.

Learn more about the Thomas G. Crowder Woodland Center

Tucker House

418 N. Person St, 27604

Contact: Vanessa Jeter | 919-996-4363

Tucker House

Indoor and outdoor venue, 50 seated/100 max capacity, $110/hr for Raleigh residents, $160/hr for non-residents (four hour minimum)

Walnut Creek Wetland Park

919-996-2760 | 950 Peterson St, 27610

Neuse River Room

Indoor venue, 62 capacity, $80/hr (two hour minimum)

East deck (covered) is also available for this room at an addition $55/hr

Walnut Creek Room

Indoor venue, 49 capacity, $65/hr (two hour minimum)

West deck (covered) is also available for this room at an addition $55/hr

Learn More about Walnut Creek Wetland Park
